author: Staff Reporter
text:
Sleuths of the Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption (DVAC) wing, Vellore, on Sunday nabbed a 55-year-old woman extension officer of the Social Welfare Department for demanding a bribe of Rs. 1,500.

Chitrangi was arrested following a complaint from Manjula (46), a resident of Gudiyatham. On January 7, Manjula had lodged a complaint with the DVAC saying that Chitrangi demanded Rs. 1,500 for recommending and forwarding her application and documents for getting assistance under Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme to the District Social Welfare Officer (DSWO).

M. Balasubramanian, Additional Superintendent of Police, DVAC, Vellore, said Manjula’s daughter Pavithra had got married on November 22 last. They had applied online for getting the assistance under the scheme two days earlier. Under the scheme, the beneficiary would receive a sum of Rs. 25,000 and a four-gram gold coin. “Following the online application, the officials undertook verification and sought a few documents. Manjula submitted the documents. Next, the application should be sent to the District Social Welfare Officer,” he explained.

Chitrangi initially demanded Rs. 2,000 as bribe from Manjula for recommending and sending the application to DSWO, and later settled down for Rs. 1,500. Following Manjula’s complaint, the DVAC conducted a preliminary inquiry. They nabbed Chitrangi at the Gudiyatham Block Development Office after she received the money from Manjula on Sunday.

She had demanded Rs. 1,500 to forward a plea seeking aid under marriage scheme
title: Extension officer held on graft charge
